thread.title: A 3rd of Britons born in 2015 will develop dementia – study
thread.title_full: A 3rd of Britons born in 2015 will develop dementia – study | News24

author: news24.com
title: A 3rd of Britons born in 2015 will develop dementia – study
text:
London - One in three people born in Britain in 2015 will develop dementia, according to an analysis commissioned by the charity campaign group Alzheimer's Research UK.
The study, conducted by the Office of Health Economics, shows "a looming national health crisis as the UK population ages", the charity said, and underlines the need for global efforts to develop treatments for the brain-wasting condition.
Dementia already affects at least 850 000 people in Britain, and a total of 35.6 million worldwide, according to the World Health Organisation.
It is caused by brain diseases, most commonly Alzheimer's disease, which result in the loss of brain cells and affect memory, thinking, behaviour and the ability to perform everyday activities.
